channel.title: Mysql on Sad Robot
channel.description: Recent content in Mysql on Sad Robot

item.title: Finding duplicated data across one or more columns in a database table
item.description: A few months ago I posted a little query about finding duplicate rows in a database table. I’m revisiting this because I helped out Doogie with a similar query last night but with some complications. Let’s start with the original simple scenario of checking duplicates in a single column. Some example data, a Users table: +-—+-–-–-–-–-—+ | Id | Email | +-—+-–-–-–-–-—+ | 1 | joe@bloggs.com | | 2 | joe@bloggs.
